Language: Bulgarian, Czech, English, Estonian, Hungarian, Macedonian, Persian, Polish, Romanian, Serbian, Slovak, Slovenian
Description: Parallel corpus of George Orwell's 1984 and its translations

Corpus: Electronic text corpus of Sumerian literature (ETCSL)
Description: A selection of nearly 400 literary compositions recorded on sources which come from ancient Mesopotamia and date to the late third and early second millennia BCE.
Masterpieces of Latvian literature from the beginning of Latvian literature until first decades of 20th century
Selected masterpieces of Latvian literature from the end of the 19th century and the beginning of the 20th century

A corpus of 60 Bonnier novels from 1980-81. The material is sentence scrambled.
A corpus of 69 Bonnier novels from 1976-77.

POE: Microcorpus of 20th century Polish poetry

Description: Samples of the Finnish literature representing various text types
Kerttu Vuolab's novel Cheppari cháráhus
Estonian fiction texts from 1990

Corpus: Collection of older original Estonian-language works of fiction
Description: Web collection of older Estonian literary texts "Kreutzwald's Century: the Estonian Cultural History Web". The electronically republished books, included in the collection, are based on the first editions of works by more important Estonian authors, published in 1854-1944.

These are the oldest text recordings of Estonian runic songs (the text recordings were created in the 19th century and in the first decades of the 20th century). In addition to the runic songs, the database also has songs of transitional form and end-rhymed songs (about 6000).

Corpus: NorGramBank children’s fiction in Norwegian Bokmål
NorGrambank children's fiction in Norwegian Nynorsk

Description: 70 copyright-free classics (61 Portugal and 9 from Brazil) published before 1940.

Corpus: Classics of Finnish Literature, Kielipankki Version
Description:
Works of established Finnish authors published from 1880s to 1949. Includes 
prose fiction, plays, poetry and aphorisms, some written originally in 
Swedish.
Note: (NB: Some outdated metadata of the same resource is apparently available via LINDAT, http://hdl.handle.net/11372/LRT-773, which should be disregarded.)

Description: literary texts from 1100 to 1400.

Description: poems from 1564 to 1939.

Corpus: Classics Library of the National Library of Finland - Kielipankki version
Description: literary texts from 1549 to 1944.

Corpus: York-Helsinki Parsed Corpus of Old English Poetry
Description: A selection of poetic texts (71,490 words) from the Old English Section of the Helsinki Corpus of English Texts, syntactically and morphologically annotated.

Corpus: Electronic corpus of 15th-century Castilian cancionero manuscripts
Description: Dutton lyric corpus of 15th century cancioneros, and the Severin-Maguire corpus of didactic poetry (15th century Castilian cancionero poetry)

Novel by Melpo Axioti, République-Bastille (1948-1949), Mary Mike ed. (Thessaloniki, 2014). The French text is of particular linguistic interest since it is a text written in a language other than the mother tongue and is suited for research on bilingualism and self-translation. It would be worth measuring the naturalness of the language with computational tools, for example.
A journal of undergraduate creative writing of the Faculty of English Language and Literature.

The Corpus of medieval texts contains written material covering the period from the 4th till the 16th century A.D. The texts can be classified into the following categories: religious, poetical-literary, political-historical, hymns, epigrams.

Corpus: Classics of English and American Literature in Finnish (CEAL)
Description: The corpus contains the Finnish translations of the following three texts: Jane Austen: Ylpeys ja ennakkoluulo (Pride and Prejudice), translated by Kersti Juva, Teos 2013; Henry James: Washingtonin aukio (Washington Square), translated by Kersti Juva, Otava 2003; Charles Dickens: Kolea talo (Bleak House), translated by Kersti Juva, Tammi, 2006.
Note: Variants of the same content are available via Korp and for download.

Description: The corpus contains Finnish books made available by the Gutenberg project. The texts have not been linguistically annotated.

All the known letters, manuscripts and published works by Finnish author Aleksis Kivi (1834–1872). Most of the texts were written in Finnish while some of the letters and  manuscripts are in Swedish. Time coverage of the texts: 1855-1871.

Corpus: ParRus 2016, Russian-Finnish Parallel Corpus of Literary Texts
Description: Russian literary texts (classical literature & 20th century) and their translations into Finnish aligned at paragraph level.

Corpus: ParFin 2016, Finnish-Russian Parallel Corpus of Literary Texts
Description: The corpus contains Finnish literary texts from 1990-2010 and their translations into Russian aligned at sentence level.

Corpus: The Morpho-Syntactic Database of Mikael Agricola's Works
Description: The Morpho-Syntactic Database of Mikael Agricola's Works contains the Finnish parts of Mikael Agricola’s works (Abckiria, Rukouskiria, Se Wsi testamenti, Käsikiria, Messu,  Piina, Psaltari, Veisut, Profeetat)
The North Saami Corpus  contains Kerttu Vuolab's novel Cheppari cháráhus written in Northern Sami.
